required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optical Detection of Intravenous Infiltration:A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the use of the ivWatch Model 400 to monitor PIV sites in pediatric patients. Half the participants will be monitored by the device without infiltration notifications and the other half will be monitored by the device with infiltration notifications enabled.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of intravenous therapy, an expected duration of up to 1 week
primary_outcome.description: The difference in time to detection between the clinician and the ivWatch device is measured from the non-alarming group. This measurement reveals how much earlier the infiltration could have been detected by the ivWatch device compared to the clinician assessments. This metric is measured using the patients in the non-alarming group since an infiltration notification by the ivWatch device could bias the clinician's diagnosis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of intravenous therapy, an expected duration of up to 1 week
primary_outcome.description: The infiltration sensitivity is defined as the percentage of the clinician-confirmed infiltrations that are detected by the ivWatch device before the clinician's diagnosis. This metric is measured and reported separately for non-alarming and alarming groups, since an infiltration notification by the ivWatch device could bias the clinician's diagnosis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of intravenous therapy, an expected duration of up to 1 week
primary_outcome.description: The notification rate is defined as the number of ivWatch device infiltration notifications issued in a certain amount of time, typically reported in units of notifications per day. The notification rate is the number of notifications per day, excluding cases with clinician confirmed infiltrations. This metric is measured using the subjects in the alarming group since the number of notifications could potentially depend on how quickly nurses reset the device.

arm_group.description: A non-alarming ivWatch device will monitor the IV sites of these subjects. The goal of this small pilot study is to give clinicians an opportunity to perform the protocol and operate the ivWatch device and to give researchers the ability to make adjustments prior to starting the subsequent non-alarming group.
150 patients will be enrolled in the non-alarming group. The ivWatch device will monitor the IV sites but will not issue infiltration notifications.
150 patients will be enrolled in the alarming group. The IV sites will be monitored with the ivWatch Model 400 infiltration notifications enabled.

intervention.description: The ivWatch Model 400 is placed next to the subject's PIV site. All subjects will receive standard care for their IV sites including the normal routine assessments of the IV site by the bedside registered nurses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed consent and/or assent
- Newborn to 17 years of age
- Weight > 2.5 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe skin integrity issues such as severe eczema, burns, epidermolysis bullosa, rash, hives
- Severe scarring of tissue (excessive IV use)
- Tattoo in area of PIV site
- IV site located in antecubital fossa

group.title: Non-alarming
group.description: The ivWatch device will monitor the IV sites but will not issue infiltration notifications. ivWatch Model 400: The ivWatch Model 400 is placed next to the subject's PIV site. All subjects will receive standard care for their IV sites including the normal routine assessments of the IV site by the bedside registered nurses. Patients enrolled into the pilot and non-alarming portion of the study were combined for analysis due to no protocol changes between the study arms.

group.title: Alarming
group.description: The IV sites will be monitored with the ivWatch Model 400 infiltration notifications enabled. ivWatch Model 400: The ivWatch Model 400 is placed next to the subject's PIV site. All subjects will receive standard care for their IV sites including the normal routine assessments of the IV site by the bedside registered nurses.

Patients enrolled into the pilot and non-alarming portion of the study were combined for analysis due to no protocol changes between the study arms.

group.description: The IV sites will be monitored with the ivWatch Model 400 infiltration notifications enabled. ivWatch Model 400: The ivWatch Model 400 is placed next to the subject's PIV site. All subjects will receive standard care for their IV sites including the normal routine assessments of the IV site by the bedside registered nurses.

outcome.title: Time Infiltration Detected by Nurse
outcome.description: The difference in time to detection between the clinician and the ivWatch device is measured from the non-alarming group. This measurement reveals how much earlier the infiltration could have been detected by the ivWatch device compared to the clinician assessments. This metric is measured using the patients in the non-alarming group since an infiltration notification by the ivWatch device could bias the clinician’s diagnosis.
outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of intravenous therapy, an expected duration of up to 1 week

All subjects will receive standard care for their IV sites including the normal routine assessments of the IV site by the bedside registered nurses. Patients enrolled into the pilot and non-alarming portion of the study were combined for analysis due to no protocol changes between the study arms.

This measurement reveals how much earlier the infiltration could have been detected by the ivWatch device compared to the clinician assessments. This metric is measured using the patients in the non-alarming group since an infiltration notification by the ivWatch device could bias the clinician’s diagnosis.

outcome.description: The infiltration sensitivity is defined as the percentage of the clinician-confirmed infiltrations that are detected by the ivWatch device before the clinician’s diagnosis. This metric is measured and reported separately for non-alarming and alarming groups, since an infiltration notification by the ivWatch device could bias the clinician’s diagnosis.

measure.description: The infiltration sensitivity is defined as the percentage of the clinician-confirmed infiltrations that are detected by the ivWatch device before the clinician’s diagnosis. This metric is measured and reported separately for non-alarming and alarming groups, since an infiltration notification by the ivWatch device could bias the clinician’s diagnosis.

outcome.title: Notification Rate of ivWatch Device
outcome.description: The notification rate is defined as the number of ivWatch device infiltration notifications issued in a certain amount of time, typically reported in units of notifications per day. The notification rate is the number of notifications per day, excluding cases with clinician confirmed infiltrations. This metric is measured using the subjects in the alarming group since the number of notifications could potentially depend on how quickly nurses reset the device.
outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of intravenous therapy, an expected duration of up to 1 week
outcome.population: The number of participated in the Alarming group that did not have an infiltration diagnosed by a clinician.

group.description: The IV sites will be monitored with the ivWatch Model 400 infiltration notifications enabled. ivWatch Model 400: The ivWatch Model 400 is placed next to the subject's PIV site. All subjects will receive standard care for their IV sites including the normal routine assessments of the IV site by the bedside registered nurses.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
